title: Face-tan
benefits: Lemon packed with ascorbic, glycolic and alpha-hydroxy acids this natural bleacher exfoliates the superficial layer of the skin, undoing any kind of sun damage and darkening. Add a dash of honey (a natural humectant) to the lemon juice for best results, as it’s known to be too drying.
directions: Simply mix it with honey to make a thick paste and apply it on your face. And then wash it off after 20 minutes.
notes: Lemon aka our star ingredient is so acidic that we wouldn’t suggest applying it on its own, especially before stepping out into the sun, as it can cause more damage than good.

title: Face-tan

title: Hyperpigmentation
benefits: Apple cider vinegar contains acetic acid, which may act as a mild chemical peel in some cases.Apple cider vinegar also contains polyphenols. These act as antioxidants and may protect skin cells.
directions: Apply 1 part apple cider vinegar and 1 part water to the pigmented area for a few minutes, twice daily. Rinse the area thoroughly afterward.
notes: Keep an eye out for any signs of irritation, and stop using the vinegar if irritation appears in the area.

title: Hyperpigmentation
benefits: Yogurt and milk both contain lactic acid, which is a common ingredient in chemical peels for the skin. The small quantities in these foods may help with mild hyperpigmentation as well.
directions: Applying yogurt or milk directly to the pigmented area or soaking a cotton ball in milk and applying it to the area may both be helpful home remedies.People should let the yogurt or milk sit for a few minutes, and then rinse the area thoroughly and apply moisturizer.
notes: Repeating this process two times a day may help some people improve their skin spots.

title: Hyperpigmentation
benefits: Green tea and its main active ingredient, epigallocatechin-3-gallate (EGCG), may help alter pigmentation of the skin in some cases.EGCG is an antioxidant compound that could help block the processes in cells that lead to over pigmentation. The green tea leaves themselves also contain gallic acid and ellagic acid, which may help improve skin.
directions: For people who want to use this remedy, taking an oral EGCG supplement or applying a wet green tea bag to the pigmented area for a few minutes each day may help.

title: Hyperpigmentation
benefits: Red onions, or Allium cepa, may also be a helpful skin whitening agent for some people.Red onion blocks the cell actions that lead to excess pigmentation.
directions: A simple way to use red onion is by grinding the onion up and adding it to an empty tea bag. Apply the bag to the area of hyperpigmentation, using medical tape to hold it on the skin if necessary.

title: Hyperpigmentation
benefits: Aloe vera’s active ingredient, called aloesin or aloin, could help reduce pigmentation of the skin.
directions: Applying aloe vera gel directly to the pigmented skin may also be a good way to reduce pigmentation over time.

title: Face Mask
benefits: Avocado’s natural oils combined with honey’s humectant properties deeply nourish and hydrate the skin
directions: Mash half an avocado and mix it with a tablespoon of honey. Apply for 15-20 minutes and rinse off for a supple complexion.

title: Face Mask
benefits: Rich in vitamins and probiotics, this mask hydrates and nourishes the skin.
directions: Mash a ripe banana and combine it with yogurt for a moisturizing boost.Leave on for 15-20 minutes and wash off with lukewarm water.
